'''Cerin Amroth''' was a hill in the heart of the ancient Elven realm of [[Lothlórien]].

==Geography==
The slopes of the hill were covered with grass and with the flowers ''[[Elanor (flower)|elanor]]'' and ''[[niphredil]]''. On the top of the hill grew two circles of trees: an outer circle of leafless trees with snow-white bark and an inner circle of ''[[mallorn|mallorn-trees]]''. In the centre of the inner circle stood a very tall tree with a white [[flet]] built high amid its branches.<ref name="Lorien">{{FR|Lorien}}, p. 350</ref> 

==History==
The hill received its name, Cerin Amroth ("Amroth's Mound"), in the [[Third Age]] when [[Amroth]], the [[King of Lórien]], lived in the high trees in the fashion of the [[Silvan Elves]] on the hill. The main function of the flet on the hill was to watch the fortress of [[Dol Guldur]].<ref>{{UT|Amroth}}</ref> The hill retained its name after Amroth left his kingdom with his lover [[Nimrodel]] and many other Elves of Lothlórien in {{TA|1981}}.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 1981, p. 1087</ref>

On the evening of Midsummer<ref>{{App|Tale}}, p. 1060</ref> of {{TA|2980}} [[Aragorn]] and [[Arwen]] promised to marry each other on Cerin Amroth.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2980, p. 1090</ref>

On 17 January {{TA|3019}},<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, January 17, p. 1092</ref> the [[Fellowship of the Ring]], except [[Gandalf]] who had fallen off the [[Bridge of Khazad-dûm]], briefly visited Cerin Amroth. [[Frodo]] and [[Sam]] climbed up to the flet with [[Haldir]] and were able to see much of the land of Lothlórien, as well as southern [[Mirkwood]] with the hill of Dol Guldur in its centre.<ref>{{FR|Lorien}}, p. 352</ref>

After the death of Aragorn on 1 March {{FoA|120}},<ref>{{App|Later}}, entry for the year S.R. 1541, p. 1098</ref> Arwen went to Lothlórien, where she lived alone for a few months, eventually surrendering her life on Cerin Amroth before the beginning of spring. Her green grave was on Cerin Amroth.<ref>{{App|Tale}}, p. 1063</ref>

==Etymology==
{{Pronounce|Cerin Amroth.mp3|Ardamir}}
''Cerin Amroth'' is a [[Sindarin]] name meaning "Amroth's Mound", consisting of ''[[cerin]]'' and ''[[Amroth#Etymology|Amroth]]''.<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Cerin Amroth'', p. 309</ref>
